Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, whose provenance is not known, is a private letter written in Greek mentioning a sum of money, matrasses and the town of Alexandria. The verso also contains a greeting formula on the part of a person named Tekla. The paleography and the abbreviation of the word "kyrios" (lord) demonstrates that the letter dates from the 5th century of our time.
